definition[0]: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have
example[0]: The report concluded that the school should be closed immediately.
example[1]: Richardson concluded from his studies that equality between the sexes is still a long way off.
explanation[0]: In more formal English, you can say it is concluded that something is true
example[2]: It was concluded that the treatment should be stopped
definition[1]: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time
example[3]: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
example[4]: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
definition[2]: to end something such as a meeting, book, event, or speech by doing or saying one final thing
example[5]: To conclude, I’d like to express my thanks to my family.
example[6]: ‘So now, ’ she concluded, ‘I’m trying to bring some order to the garden.’
example[7]: Each chapter concludes with a short summary.
example[8]: She concluded by saying she was proud to be from Salford.
definition[3]: to decide that something is true after considering all the facts
example[9]: The Stock Exchange concluded that the accounts could be regarded as suspect because they made no reference to such businesses.
example[10]: We can conclude from the statistics that there is still an imbalance between the opportunities for men and women.
definition[4]: to finish arranging an agreement, treaty, deal etc
example[11]: We would like to conclude the deal by the end of the financial year.
definition[5]: when something concludes, or you conclude it, it ends
example[12]: By five the interview had at last concluded and we left.
example[13]: Anxious to conclude the meeting, he added: “All the figures you need are in the business plan.”
